intro: Mantiqueira bella, commonly known as the Brazilian bellflower, is a perennial plant native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, hairy stems. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Mantiqueira bella thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas.
